intro: Grevillea capillaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Proteaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and ecologically significant species. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Grevillea capillaris is also valued for its ability to attract native birds and insects.
